title: Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia reveals being bullied at school shaped who he is today
text:
Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia has revealed how his troubling childhood and the shock death of his father shaped who is today.

The 27-year-old said growing up, he lacked confidence and faced constant harassment at school.

Speaking to nine.com.au, he revealed: 'At school, I was chubby and short, and I wasn't really outgoing at all. I would just cruise, I wouldn't do anything'.

'I was chubby and short, and I wasn't outgoing at all': Love Island Australia's Adam Farrugia (pictured) revealed on Saturday that being an outcast at school shaped him

Everything suddenly changed when he dropped out of school to work an apprenticeship.

'You're not in the playground having childish s**t happen to ya. Bullying people is childish. It doesn't make your light shine any brighter,' he said.

Four years ago, Adam's father died suddenly of a heart attack and the star said it had a devastating impact on him.

Speaking to nine.com.au, he revealed: 'At school, I was chubby and short, and I wasn't really outgoing at all. I would just cruise, I wouldn't do anything'

'At the start I just shut it all off to be honest. Just cancelled it out. Almost pretended in my head like it didn't happen,' he revealed to the publication.

The star said he struggled to even process the death but he worked through it with his mother, sister and good mates who had also gone through difficult experiences.

'If you've got a good friend base – that are always there. Not just the ones that are there for the good times and then the bad times come and they disappear,' he said.

Looking: The Queensland-based plasterer admits that he has never had a serious girlfriend

Love wanted: He is hoping his stint on Love Island Australia will change this, while looking for a partner who can 'tolerate' him

The Queensland-based plasterer admits that he has never had a serious girlfriend.

He is hoping his stint on Love Island Australia will change this, while looking for a partner who can 'tolerate' him.

Adam says his ideal girl is tall and is skilled at banter so that she can put him in his place.
